bug.short_desc: tlp-stat syntax error lines 1217 and 1221 unary operator expected
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Calling tlp-stat end with two error messages due to syntax error in the script.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): tlp-0.9-2.fc25.noarch
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. call tlp-stat
Actual results: The output ends with: /bin/tlp-stat: line 1217: [: -ne: unary operator expected /bin/tlp-stat: line 1221: [: -ne: unary operator expected
Expected results: No syntax error message.
Additional info: Looking at the code, I guess that it's due to: cat: /sys/class/power_supply/BAT1/energy_full_design: No such device cat: /sys/class/power_supply/BAT1/energy_full: No such device meaning that $ed and $ef are not set, which the code doesn't expect.
I would say this is due to both /sys/class/power_supply/BAT1/energy_full and /sys/class/power_supply/BAT1/charge_full being missing on your system. Can you confirm this?

Actually, the files were there but they were not related to any device (if I remove the battery, the message becomes "No such file or directory"). It was probably due to the battery being completely empty: after a load the files and their devices were there again.
Your analysis is kind of correct, but the script should be improved to catch cleanly such use case.

Understood, I've contacted upstream and I will be back-porting a fix.
Thanks for your feedback!
tlp-0.9-4.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-3467d39a3e
tlp-0.9-4.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-63643860fe
